Coffee's caffeine "jolt" can often result in symptoms of anxiety. Photo Credit DimaSobko/iStock/Getty Images. A staple beverage for millions of people worldwide, coffee is the definitive morning eye-opener and afternoon or late-night pick-me-up. However, the alertness and burst of energy you feel from coffee may result in anxiety, manifesting in a variety of ways. The connection between coffee-induced anxiety is a crucial issue to examine, whether you're an occasional coffee drinker or a true javaholic..

How To Grind Coffee With A Blade Grinder. (Also known as a coffee mill ) This type of grinder usually has a clear plastic top that covers a coffee bean reservoir. The blade looks (and works) like a propeller and is seated in the center of the reservoir.
